intro: Elsholtzia stauntonii, commonly known as the mountain betony, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. Its flowers are small, tubular, and usually pink or purple, arranged in dense spikes at the top of the stems. Elsholtzia stauntonii is often found in rocky or well-drained soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
